Package siren.factories

Provides classes that are responsible for the construction of other siren classes.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BuilderFactory<T extends Builder>
    Defines the contract that all types choosing to be a BuilderFactory must abide by.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ActionBuilderFactory
    Constructs instances of Action.Builder.
    EmbeddedLinkSubEntityBuilderFactory
    Constructs instances of EmbeddedLinkSubEntity.Builder.
    EmbeddedRepresentationSubEntityBuilderFactory
    Constructs instances of EmbeddedRepresentationSubEntity.Builder.
    EntityBuilderFactory
    Constructs instances of EntityBuilderFactory.
    FieldBuilderFactory<T>
    Constructs instances of Field.Builder.
    LinkBuilderFactory
    Constructs instances of Link.Builder.

Package siren.factories Description

Provides classes that are responsible for the construction of other siren classes. The factories defined in this package alleviate the burden of client applications needing to manage the logic of creating instances of other siren classes, such as Entity. A common practical use case of these factories is dependency injection. Utilizing dependency injection, client applications can control the object lifecycle of instances of the factory classes, while using them to generate instances of other siren classes in the class receiving the injection.
Since:
9/13/17
Author:
jonfreer
